ЁЯСС
Vikramaditya

The most famous 'Vikramaditya' in history. He defeated the Sakas (Western Satraps), assumed the title 'Shakari', and made Ujjain his second capital.

ЁЯТО
Navaratnas (Nine Gems)

His court had nine renowned scholars known as 'Navaratnas': Kalidasa (poet), Amarasimha (lexicographer), Varahamihira (astronomer), Dhanvantari (physician), Kshapanaka, Shanku, Vetala Bhatta, Ghatakarpara, and Vararuci.

ЁЯЪ╢
Journey of Fa-Hien

The Chinese traveler Fa-Hien (399-414 CE) visited India during his reign. He praised Pataliputra and the Gupta administration.

ЁЯУМ
Important Facts (Exam Points)
  • Titles: Vikramaditya, Shakari, Devagupta, Devaraja, Paramabhagavata.
  • Monument: Mehrauli Iron Pillar - bearing the name of King 'Chandra', it has remained rust-free to this day.
  • Coinage: Issued silver coins (Rupaka) for the first time among the Guptas (after the conquest of the Sakas).
  • Matrimonial Alliance: Married his daughter Prabhavatigupta to the Vakataka king Rudrasena II.
